intro: Trimezia itamarajuensis, commonly known as the Itamaraju starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It is a perennial herb that produces small, tubular flowers clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
